utterances.speaker: JUAN WILLIAMS, HOST
utterances.utterance: Hello, everyone. I'm Juan Williams along with Katie Pavlich, Jesse Watters, Dana Perino, and guess who's back? It's Greg.

utterances.speaker: GREG GUTFELD, HOST
utterances.utterance: It's me.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: It's 5 o'clock in New York City, this is “The Five.” Breaking news, big trouble could be brewing for Andrew McCabe, federal prosecutors now recommend moving forward with criminal charges against the former FBI deputy director. It's unclear at this moment what those charges might be, but here's what we do know. McCabe was fired right before his retirement in 2019. It happened after the Justice Department inspector general found he authorized a media leak about an investigation into the Clinton foundation. The I.G. determined that McCabe did not tell the truth about what happened. Jesse, you know, obviously, McCabe has been targeted by President Trump for a lot of, you know, nastiness. What do you think this means for Andrew McCabe right now?

utterances.speaker: JESSE WATTERS, HOST
utterances.utterance: It's not good. I mean, let's remember, Juan, McCabe targeted Donald Trump, that's how this whole thing happened.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Wait a second --

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: And I think --

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: -- this is about the Clinton foundation. Actually, targeted --

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: This lie that he told to the feds, yes, was about that. But let's also remember this, he tried to take the president out, they hatched the insurance plot in his office, and when the president caught wind to that insurance policy and fired his boss, Comey, then McCabe comes along and wants people wearing wires and wants people getting Trump out of office undemocratically. And that's what this is about. This is the reason why Trump was elected in the first place. People want to see justice in this country. Smollett walks away. Hillary walks away. No one gets locked up after the financial crash. They want to see justice applied equally. So, I hope that he pays a price for this. Not only him, all the other people in the Cabal.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Jesse, but what about the victims?

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Who is it, Greg?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: CNN. I mean, this was their prime CNN contributor that they've just hired, and now he's gone. They need a replacement. So I came up with two.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: The situation, he just got out of jail, Jersey Shore. He's looking for a gig. I just saw him on Prince Street walking around look pretty analyst. Then you've got O.J., right? O.J., he's giving a lot of hot takes on twitter. You just don't want to piss him off. But I think it's time.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: That's like when the Patriots sign A.B., and then the next day he gets hit with the rape charge.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yeah.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Bad timing for CNN.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: But this is vindication for victims of prolong hysteria. It's a lesson. Don't try to organize a legal coup because you don't like the election. Maybe just go with it. Get a hobby. Have some fun for a couple years, think about it.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: So, Dana, back to the story here. We have to -- we have now --

utterances.speaker: DANA PERINO, HOST
utterances.utterance: The news.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: -- such energy coming from Greg. But the reality is that the grand jury investigating the case was recalled. We don't know why. They've got to get a majority of the people on the grand jury to agree to - - but we don't know what it's about.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Yes. So I'm going to not speculate because I don't know, but remember the Justice Department under Attorney General Barr has declined to go forward and prosecute a couple of others, and I can't even remember what their names are now because if you don't get prosecuted you don't actually -- you kind of go into obscurity. Comey, there you go. Obscurity, how can I say that? But remember also for McCabe, think about all the people that donated to his legal defense fund. I mean, a lot of people donated a ton of money. He got a big book deal. He got a big CNN contract. Like the guy is basically -- he set himself up to try to fight fire with fire, but when a grand jury gets recalled, that doesn't sound good.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: You know what, Katie, I mean, there was an effort by McCabe's lawyers to try to get the D.C. -- attorney general for the district of Columbia say, you know what, we don't need to prosecute him. This has come back to bite him.

utterances.speaker: KATIE PAVLICH, HOST
utterances.utterance: Well, his attorneys were actually quite arrogant and overconfident, I think, when he was referred for criminal charges last year by the inspector general. They were confident this would go nowhere. They'll be able to work out some deal. But Andrew McCabe is being referred not just by the I.G., but look into by the U.S. attorney because he lied to federal investigators, inspector general investigators, and FBI agents under oath three times. It's on the record. And Andrew McCabe is being held to the same standards that he held everybody else to when he was the deputy FBI director.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: So quick question --

utterances.speaker: PAVLICH
utterances.utterance: There're people that he has put in prison. He's taken away their liberties for doing the same thing that he did, and he should be held accountable for it.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Just quick question. Jim Comey, though, they've said, no prosecution.

utterances.speaker: PAVLICH
utterances.utterance: Well, they're separate cases. I mean, there's obvious more evidence here for the U.S. attorney in D.C. to look at it and say we should proceed with looking at charges. The New York Times reported about a week ago that this possible indictment was coming. I don't know what the charges are going to be either, but perjury looks like one of them, considering that the list of things in the I.G. report were about lying under oath to federal agents.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: So, Greg, welcome back.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Thank you.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Did you miss this kind of argument?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: I did. Where I was there was no news. No word of the Trump phenomenon, politics --

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Wait a second, I heard about a typhoon.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: There was a typhoon, believe me. There was a typhoon. But this kind of typhoon, the orange typhoon did not reach Japan, but it was quite delightful.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: What do you think of this?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: What I think of what, this?

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: I just told you.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: OK. I thought -- All right. All right.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yeah.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: All right.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: I'm over it.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Switching gears now, Democrats taking a big step in the push to impeach President Trump. The House Judiciary Committee passing a resolution outlining how impeachment hearings would play out if Democrats decide they want to move forward. The chairman, Jerry Nadler, and the ranking Republican on the committee, they're clashing over the move.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.utterance: With these new procedures, we will begin next week an aggressive series of hearings investigating allegations of corruption, obstruction, and abuse of power against the president. The investigation will go well beyond the four corners of the Mueller report.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.utterance: The judiciary committee has became a giant Instagram filter to make you appear there's something happening that's not.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: You know, as a person who's on the spot here, Dana, is Nancy Pelosi. I think she's torn between people who say -- the Democratic base that says let's have impeachment, and all the members of the Congress who actually gave them the majority, many of them coming from Trump majority districts, who don't want this.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: I don't think she is torn, OK. Like, so she might have a split within her caucus because I think she knows very well that impeachment is not a good idea, and that is why she's like, OK, fine. Go outside and play, everybody. Go outside and play, and then everyone is going to come back for dinner, we're going to vote on the things that matter to the American people and she'll list them out. I think that there's a parallel universe happening with some Democrats that do want impeachment. I don't think she wants it. And I think she probably thinks, well, there's only X amount of working days between now and the end of the year. They're not going to do impeachment before then.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Jesse, do you think Republicans would be delighted to see Democrats in the House try to do impeachment, say, oh, look at these Democrats, they're just got Trump derangement syndrome.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: No, I don't think so. I don't think anybody wants impeachment. And that's actually what Jerry Nadler said in the late-90's when he said that you should not impeach if it's on partisan lines. You should not do it if the country is not behind you because it's just going to tear the country apart. And now he's doing the exact same thing because there's a different president with a different letter after his name in the White House. This is like trying to ground your child after the kid has already moved out of the house. Like, let it go. It is over, Democrats. There's nothing on collusion, and the Justice Department said no obstruction. So, Nancy's right. This is only going to hurt people in swing districts and -- I can't believe -- did I just say Nancy's right?

utterances.speaker: PAVLICH
utterances.utterance: You did.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: So, Katie, I think the two things are, one, whether or not there're taxpayer dollars going to Trump properties like he's getting the army people --

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Oh, that's what we're about --

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: That's one of them, and the other one is obstruction.

utterances.speaker: PAVLICH
utterances.utterance: I think what -- the only taxpayer dollars here are being wasted on another investigation. Jerry Nadler is actually lying about this when he says, we're going to go past the four corners of the Mueller report. Not true. And he's also sending out fundraising email saying that a real impeachment inquiry has been open. So they're being dishonest and they're wasting taxpayer money by doing it.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Do you like this impeachment effort?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Oh, I love it. No, impeachment is what you get when you have a great -- when you're living in a great time and you're suffering from amnesia. I wasn't here yesterday for 9/11. It's 9/12 and they're not thinking about how to prevent a 9/11, they're thinking about impeachment. That's a crime. I mean, at least we know what Trump is doing about terror. If it happens again we also know what the Democrats were doing. They were doing this and that's a shame.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: OK. Biden's camp criticizes the media. Elizabeth Warren accused of being a hypocrite, and Trump trolling his White House rivals. That's all up in our 2020 round up of politics. That's ahead on The Five.

utterances.speaker: PAVLICH
utterances.utterance: Well, it's a huge night for Democrats in what could be a make or break moment for many of their campaigns. First up in our 2020 roundup, instead of projecting confidence, Joe Biden's team is going after the media. Biden's camp claims the reason for recent negative coverages is isn't because of his endless gaffs, instead they're blaming it on young reporters who think the 76-year-old is uncool. Greg, you left. Is he uncool?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: No.

utterances.speaker: PAVLICH
utterances.utterance: Is he wise?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: No. He's got problems and the media is not doing Joe any favors by treating him like a Faberge egg. So he's saying that they're picking on him. They're not. They're doing a reverse Trump. They're taking the spotlight away from him because at certain times he just doesn't look healthy, he doesn't look right, but they're fattening him up like a prized veal for Trump. He's like sitting in a tight cage because he's not working the muscles and he's becoming slow, succulent, and unprepared for the (INAUDIBLE). It's going to be so bad. It's so bad. And they really need to get him out of there because it's not going to look good in a year.

utterances.speaker: PAVLICH
utterances.utterance: Jesse?

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: I think he gets bad press because he's a bad candidate. He's a relic. He's not a rock star. He wears aviators and was Barack's V.P. So what? I mean, if I were a reporter covering these people, I wouldn't want to cover him. I'd rather cover Buttigieg. I'd rather cover Elizabeth Warren, even Beto O'Rourke. Yeah. I mean, the guy is a gaffe machine. He doesn't attract any crowds. I just don't see it. If you're complaining about the press and you're a Democrat, that's a problem.

utterances.speaker: PAVLICH
utterances.utterance: Yeah, because they're supposed to be on your side, right?

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Yeah. I mean, how much more help do you need?

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: I'm going to take a contrary view. I think this is signs of life from Team Biden. They are basically finally attacking something. They're attacking the press, starting to attack Elizabeth Warren, even if they're not doing it directly. The op-ed today from the former governor of Pennsylvania, former DNC chair, Ed Rendell, and calling Elizabeth Warren a hypocrite, but she's nice. I mean, that's basically what it said. I think that shows that they're willing to do some dirty work, but they're going to use their surrogates to do it. I think there's a lot more of it to come.

utterances.speaker: PAVLICH
utterances.utterance: What about that, Juan? Do you think Elizabeth Warren is going to go after Joe Biden tonight now that they're on the same stage?

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: No --

utterances.speaker: PAVLICH
utterances.utterance: They're very different lanes, right? Or do you think she'll push Biden left?

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: I mean, technically, she's going to go after anybody. She'd go after Bernie Sanders because he's the one --

utterances.speaker: PAVLICH
utterances.utterance: She's already beating Bernie Sanders now. It's like, she's --

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Correct. So I think -- look, I think the dynamic tonight is everybody says Joe Biden is in the lead. They'd love to see him take a fall, a prep fall, and then be able to take some of his votes. But do I think that Elizabeth Warren wants to be the one that looks like, you know, finger prints on the victim's back? No, because then that would hurt her with fellow Democrats big time. So I don't think she's gonna do that. In terms of this thing with reporters and Biden, look, reporters didn't think that Hillary Clinton was hip. They didn't think Donald Trump was hip, but was going to win. So, guess what, tough luck, reporters. I mean, you just go out there and cover the story. But I do think that a lot of people are just like -- especially reporters, oh, Biden is not exciting. Biden is not Obama.

utterances.speaker: PAVLICH
utterances.utterance: Well, one thing that doesn't seem to work in this new political age is being a phony. So Elizabeth Warren loves attacking the wealthy, but it turns out that she has no problem taking their money. She's also very wealthy herself. And now she's being called out for the hypocrisy, as Dana pointed out. Turns out she took a bunch of corporate cash in 2018 that she rolled over to help fund her current campaign. So, Greg, she's been on this kick of -- I don't take corporate money, I'm only listening to the grassroots, I just want small donors, but she's more than happy to actually take a lot of corporate money.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: I just see -- every time I see her I see Jiminy Cricket, and I don't know why. I don't know why. The problem is, what she's saying, her entire idea of banning fracking, to taxing everybody to sponsor a trillion dollar fantasy is not going to prevent an apocalypse at all. It's actually going to speed up the apocalypse because other countries are going to fill the void, who are less compassionate about the earth than we are. Who aren't going to listen to a 12-year-old climate activist and take their marching orders from her. Once we step off this world stage there're going to be -- there's going to be Iran, there's going to be Russia, Venezuela, are all gonna step in and they just see environment is just another road bump on the speed highway to love.

utterances.speaker: PAVLICH
utterances.utterance: Dana, in terms of the messaging on this --

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: To Marianne?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: To Marianne.

utterances.speaker: PAVLICH
utterances.utterance: Yeah, to Marianne. The Democrats in Detroit during the first debate talked about banning cars for the sake of the green new deal. Are they going to talk about fracking in Texas?

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: I don't know.

utterances.speaker: PAVLICH
utterances.utterance: I mean, are they going to go there?

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Well, it will be interesting. You asked if Warren is going to push Biden left. Like, they're already left. He said he's going to end fossil fuels in ten years. Basically in the -- since they had the last debate, one of the candidates that will be up there, Andrew Yang, talked about a possible mandatory buyback of your gas guzzling vehicle.

utterances.speaker: PAVLICH
utterances.utterance: Right.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: And be replaced by electric vehicle. I mean, they're already there. I don't think it matters if they do it in Houston or anywhere because now it's all a national campaign.

utterances.speaker: PAVLICH
utterances.utterance: Well, Andrew Yang is supposedly going to have a little bit of fun tonight, so let's listen to what he's challenged President Trump on. ANDREW YANG, 2020 DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL CANDIDATE: It would be Donald Trump, because I would school him. Donald Trump, oh, my gosh. He'd just be standing there. I'd be like, oh, oh, score left, score right. Score a jump shot.

utterances.speaker: PAVLICH
utterances.utterance: Jesse, Trump or Yang on the basketball court?

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Yeah, Yang looks like he's got some game. I saw him play a little bit. He's dunking on a 8-foot rim, which is fine. He had a decent handle and a nice jump shot. But, you know, all these things are solved on the golf course, and I think Trump would smoke him.

utterances.speaker: PAVLICH
utterances.utterance: Well, Juan, President Trump is actually trolling the candidates tonight. His campaign is going to have a huge banner saying socialism sucks, essentially, outside of the debate. Who do you think wins that argument on socialism?

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Well, I don't think there's anything that Democrats could do to prevent Donald Trump from calling them socialists. Donald Trump --

utterances.speaker: PAVLICH
utterances.utterance: But they are.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: They are not socialists.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: If you want to see what a socialist is, these are people -- I mean, if you say social security, Medicare, Medicaid is socialist. I think you lose big time with American voters. But Trump -- this is just trolling, this is silliness, and I hope the Democrats don't pay attention. David Axelrod had a piece today in the New York Times say don't let Trump get away with this kind of stuff, this jiu-jitsu. Use his energy --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: It's too late.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: -- negative energy --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: It's too late, Juan. Trump has effectively introduced a new kind of campaigning. He's introduced the concept of the Harlem Globetrotters into politics. Watch me come to town and plaster the Washington Generals. That's what it's going to be now. He's going to go through this whole thing. And wherever the Democrats show up, he's going to have a little war room and go, what can we do to mess with them? And it's -- you can't go back after this. Even if he loses, people are going to be doing this way differently.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Yeah, but people get tired of it.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Oh, I'm not.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: We've seen this act, for now. We saw it in 2016, and he doesn't stop.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Juan, when you're at the beach and then you hear that noise and you look up and you see the plane fly that little banner about dollar Coronas, it's a good feeling.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Is that right?

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Yeah, everybody loves that.

utterances.speaker: PAVLICH
utterances.utterance: Nobody looks away from the --

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: That's true.

utterances.speaker: PAVLICH
utterances.utterance: All right, coming up, we have a special treat for you. A live edition of animals are great, featuring this little guy, plus a kangaroo sloth and link, up next on The Five.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: It's Jerry Nadler.

utterances.speaker: PAVLICH
utterances.utterance: Nancy Pelosi melting down on the media over gun control. We'll play the video for you up next.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Democrats ramping up their gun-control rhetoric. Nancy Pelosi is leading the way by unleashing on Mitch McConnell and even the media. Check out these intense confrontations with reporters.

utterances.speaker: REP. NANCY PELOSI, D-CALIF.
utterances.utterance: I'm getting very angry about this silliness of these questions. Don't ask me what we haven't done. We have done it. And if you are annoyed with my impatience, it's because people are dying. Senator McConnell hasn't acted. Why don't we spend some time going over to see Mitch McConnell and ask him why he doesn't want to save lives. Why is it that you're hung up on the word over here when lives are at stake over there?

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: And that's not all, 2020 Dem Beto O'Rourke now telling banks and credit card companies to refuse service on assault weapons sales. I actually kind of appreciated the passion from Nancy Pelosi. I haven't seen that a long time.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: I'm watching and -- good for her, right? So she's got -- she's got a point to make. However, you can always tell when politicians come back from a recess and they have new focus group polling information. So what this tells me is that it doesn't work for them to go after Trump. It only works for them to go after McConnell on this, right, because --

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: It's a good point.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: -- if you think of -- think of Jim Carrey last week from Hollywood, right? So he complains that Mitch McConnell is worse than Osama Bin Laden. That more people have died because Mitch McConnell won't do anything, than Osama Bin Laden -- and then they come back from their recess and they're not saying let's take a trip down to Pennsylvania Avenue to the White House and find out what Trump's willing to do, which is what McConnell and all of his people are saying like, we'll do something depending on what the president says he is for. I don't blame them. I think that's smart politics and strategy. But for them, on the Democratic side, I think they have decided Mitch McConnell is public enemy number one on this. Mitch McConnell is very patient, so he's probably not bothered.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Greg, you just got back from your own recess.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: That's true.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: What were the focus groups is telling you over there?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Well, I did absolutely no research whatsoever, unless you count drinking whiskey alone. Saying that there're too many guns is like saying there're too many cars and there're too many drugs. It's not a debate anymore. So I have an idea -- I pitched you and you never responded to me --

utterances.speaker: PAVLICH
utterances.utterance: I don't understand cars very much.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: OK. OK. So here's my theory, there's an argument that whenever you talk about these so-called assault rifles, they're no different than hunting rifles, and it's basically true. They're the same fire power. So what's the difference, cosmetics. There something about the cosmetics that attracts a certain person, right, versus a different person. The hunter doesn't pose in front of the mirror. The guy with all the accoutrements does -- the difference between a driver of a basic Jetta and a driver who dresses it up with fancy spoilers and stripe. One is a responsible driver, the other advertises his own recklessness. So if we don't want to touch the powerful nature of a gun, why can't we address the cosmetic appeal, which tends to attract a certain kind of guy, a white, lonely male who poses and fantasizes in front of a mirror. This is merely a suggestion on my part. I'm pro-second amendment. I'm not talking about banning guns. I'm taking about if the cosmetic appeal is one of these elements that attracts somebody, what if he took it away?

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Juan, what would you say if they got rid of the military stylization that they attach to these rifles, which, as Greg said, are exactly the same as a hunting rifle?

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: No. I think the key here is the high capacity, is when you make it possible to buy high-capacity magazines that fit on to these guns. I think, then, people think this opens it up to be far more --

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: What's high-capacity in your opinion?

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: I'm not an expert --

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: No, but I mean -- you just said, you want them to load each round like --

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: By the way -- yes --

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: You do?

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: -- I think people are worry. You know it's sad to say because --

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Let me finish for a second.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: OK, go ahead.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: It's sad to say, most of the murders, you know, that we see on the streets of big cities, which is where most of this happens, happens with handguns.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Right.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: True.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: But what you see with these weapons that people are very turned off by is that you can -- you don't have high capacity and keep firing, as we saw in Vegas, as we saw in El Paso. But I will say this, I just think, right now, the polls are overwhelming, 89 percent of Americans, 8 out of 10 Republicans want background checks. We saw a letter from 145 top CEO's today saying, please do something. And guess what? The reason they're not doing anything is not Mitch McConnell because -- but he's -- he's like a rock in the road. It's President Trump and he's in the pocket of the NRA. Talk about a special interest --

utterances.speaker: PAVLICH
utterances.utterance: President Trump, actually, risked a lot with his base and with second amendment supporters in the last couple of weeks by considering some of the proposals that Democrats have put on the table, in terms of confiscation, a ban on semiautomatic sporting rifles. You say that most Americans want background checks, well, I have news for you. We have background checks in this country. The FBI does 24 million background checks every single year. We have those --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: You're an expert in this. Do you think my idea is stupid?

utterances.speaker: PAVLICH
utterances.utterance: Yeah, I do.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: OK. I just want to know because I saw your face and you're like going that doesn't make it -- but why is it stupid?

utterances.speaker: PAVLICH
utterances.utterance: Well, it's not -- I wouldn't say it's stupid. It's nice to think outside the box about why people may be attracted to these things, right? It's not because they can have overcapacity, whatever term you want to use, magazines. But I say that because the majority of mass shootings in this country are actually are carried out with handguns.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: PAVLICH
utterances.utterance: So, this idea that they're only attracted to semi-automatic rifles, just as true.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Right.

utterances.speaker: PAVLICH
utterances.utterance: And this is the most popular firearm in America. So, when you have 15 million people who own plus an AR15, it's not really going to do--

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: So, you're saying, I'm right.

utterances.speaker: PAVLICH
utterances.utterance: Sure. Yes. Greg is always correct.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: All right.

utterances.speaker: PAVLICH
utterances.utterance: I hate to go up against you.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Up next, a picture says a thousand words. Find out why Hillary Clinton was pretending to be President. Plus, it's getting wild in here for Greg's birthday. Look at that. We call it the six now. We have a new guest on set. And more Animals Are Great. A live edition coming up.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: It was as if Hillary knew today was my birthday. For what a gift she gave me and you, dear viewers. Check out these pictures of her spending an hour, leafing through her emails as part of an art exhibit in Venice. Venice, Italy, not Venice, California. I have a sneaking suspicion; she wasn't going to do this in a Southern California mall next to an anti-Ms. No, she's off to Europe where they don't have cameras or the Internet, so no one will surely see this. And if anyone takes a picture, they can just mysteriously die in a prison suicide. Just look at her. And you thought Bill was the exhibitionist in the family. Thank God they didn't turn his most memorable office moment into art. So, I hope she got paid and it better be a cool 10 million, because nothing less would get me to humiliate myself like that. And believe me I know humiliation. Speaking to the bill. Where the hell is Bill. He's the real winner here as long as she's paid to sit there for hours. He'll be haunting the Venice version of Hooters. But it's sad. She should be enjoying her best life, not reliving the worst moments in front of strangers. But she can't let go of the past or apparently the paycheck. As the curator admits the exhibition is a way to allude to an alternative world that will never exist. The bright side. It never will. So, Juan I think she did this for me, she knew it was my birthday, she knew this would make me happy. Now, are you going to do something for me for my birthday as well that will match that?

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Well, I'm going to bring some animals along. We're going to have some fun. We're going to make animals your celebration today. Happy Birthday.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Thank you.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: But I must say, I didn't understand this. It looked to me like you know self-mockery. But I guess that it was the curators who did it. And by the way, I'm totally turned off this, because some of those emails are my emails. I don't want her reading that stuff.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: That is true.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: But I just think that we play into the Russians game time and time again during the campaign when this became a big news story for no reason and now, she's keeping it alive.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: It's like Dana, she can't let go.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: See, one of the great things about getting older and they are wealthy. They don't need to do it.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Right.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: You can say no.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes, not if you like money.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: No, I'm not actually going to do that.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Not if you like money. I don't know she got paid, she must have gotten paid--

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: This was her idea.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Really?

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: This was her idea. They were having this event and all of a sudden three days before they got a call from Team Clinton. Hey, she'd like to stop by. They thought she was kidding.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Did you do more research than I did? Mark this occasion.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: I was early. I was on the Daily Briefing today.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Katie, so I have a theory, it's called the no friends signal. If you accept this deal, then you had no friends to talk you out of it. Like you've got to have a close friend who says, look, this is going to look bad.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: But if you suggested the idea.

utterances.speaker: PAVLICH
utterances.utterance: I do think that's a very smart idea as opposed to your other idea.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Oh! My gun. By the way, you said to people at home. When I come up with a gun idea, don't just say it's stupid. Say why it's stupid or I'll block you.

utterances.speaker: PAVLICH
utterances.utterance: OK. Fair enough.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Well, there is a limit on Twitter, right.

utterances.speaker: PAVLICH
utterances.utterance: What is wrong with her. What is wrong with her. She sent this out. I think it's just another display of her elitist disdain for the American people and getting away with everything her entire life.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Hos is this elite?

utterances.speaker: PAVLICH
utterances.utterance: This is a woman - because she didn't get in trouble for this and--

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: She didn't get - oh, my gosh.

utterances.speaker: PAVLICH
utterances.utterance: No, not criminally. She put people's lives--

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: It was nothing criminal--

utterances.speaker: PAVLICH
utterances.utterance: Classified information.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: It was nothing - oh, yes. Go talk to Jared and Ivanka.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: I don't think they had a server.

utterances.speaker: PAVLICH
utterances.utterance: This is the same exact thing.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Think about what type of person says on 9/11, I'm going to go to a foreign country. I'm going to stand behind a fake Oval Office and then I'm going to read through for an hour the e-mails that basically cost me the election. It's that type of thinking that cost her the election. Trump actually said this. He goes, Hillary, she just doesn't get it. And she just doesn't get it. She actually said this was a direct quote. You know I read the emails and they were kind of boring. Well, why were they boring, Hillary. You deleted 33,000 of the juicy ones. Those were the ones from Juan.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Jesse, you're scaring.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: And Greg speaking of humiliation--

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: What?

utterances.speaker: PAVLICH
utterances.utterance: You know who is missing?

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: The two defining moments in Hillary's whole professional career humiliated by Bill and then humiliated by Trump.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Get out. Better than inviting the Taliban to Camp David on 9/11. Gee, who would do that? As Rush Limbaugh said, whoever had that idea should have their head examined. Rush, it's your pal, Donald Trump. PERINO: OK.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Trump has always had this practice. If he's going to meet with somebody, he'll meet with the person, whether they're good or bad. It's just - it's his thing. You can hate it all you want, but it's his thing. WILLIAMS: Hey, Birthday Boy, look who is here.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: He's so soft.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Look at that. He really is. He weighs about eight pounds. Very calm. PERINO: He's a good little baby.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: His name is Zuko.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Zuko, yes.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: He's so soft. Is this a boy or a girl?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: It's boy. Look at the pocket. All right get ready for a live edition of Animals Are Great with this kangaroo, another furry friends. Next.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: All right, America, it's time for a live edition of Animals Are Great. That's right, Greg in celebration of your birthday, we've got some special friends from the Columbus Zoo and Aquarium. Joining us on set along with President and CEO, Tom Stalf, it's so good to have you here with us. And I think you have already made Greg's favorite birthday ever.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: While you skip the jingle, but that's OK. Yes, I am in love with this little creature here, he is my soulmate essentially.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Tell us about this guy.

utterances.speaker: TOM STALF, PRESIDENT AND CEO, COLUMBUS ZOO AND AQUARIUM
utterances.utterance: That's a two toed sloth and yes, definitely a great animal to enjoy from Central and South America.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: STALF
utterances.utterance: They are just a wonderful animal that you can find—

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Can Greg go look at it.

utterances.speaker: STALF
utterances.utterance: Yes, go over there.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: No, wait, wait. You told me not to touch it.

utterances.speaker: STALF
utterances.utterance: Don't touch it. But you can go over there.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: I don't want Greg hurt.

utterances.speaker: STALF
utterances.utterance: He'll be fine.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: It'll be worth it.

utterances.speaker: STALF
utterances.utterance: This is a two toed sloth, two different types of things. Two toed, and three toed.

utterances.speaker: PAVLICH
utterances.utterance: He's reaching out to you.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Does it do anything besides just hang there?

utterances.speaker: STALF
utterances.utterance: That's it. I mean you know--

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: It's a lot like you. Comes in late in the day, barely does any work, you are enthralled with me and I'm enthralled with you.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Greg has loved sloths for a long time. If you are a fan of Red Eye.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes, I love sloths. They're the greatest creature on our Earth.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: What attracted you to the sloth in the first place?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: I like the fact that they take their time. And they can poison you. Correct?

utterances.speaker: STALF
utterances.utterance: No.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Oh!

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: You did the research.

utterances.speaker: STALF
utterances.utterance: But the thing that's really cool about them. They live in a rainforest. They rarely go down from their tree and they'll just eat leaves all day. That's why they're so slow.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: They're so slow. How do they protect themselves from fast predators? I thought that they had sticky fingers and they killed them with the fingers.

utterances.speaker: STALF
utterances.utterance: No--

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Did I dream that?

utterances.speaker: STALF
utterances.utterance: Hang on to a tree and yes, that was a dream.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: That was a dream. I have dreams like that, sticky fingers and sloths.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Well, you be sure to be careful because Jesse was whispering to me that he likes his ass.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: All right, Tom--

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Juan, that was between us.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: That is a sloth. Greg, we have another favorite animal for you. This is lynx. We have a lynx, this is Tebow.

utterances.speaker: STALF
utterances.utterance: Tebow has got a really special story. This is Suzi Rapp from the Columbus Zoo.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Yes, Suzi we remember you from the 2016--

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: He likes to mess with paper.

utterances.speaker: STALF
utterances.utterance: So, this is a young cat. It's five months old, Tebow. It's a Canada lynx.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: That's my One More Thing.

utterances.speaker: STALF
utterances.utterance: Not anymore. But this beautiful animal that weighs about 35 pounds when it's an adult. Look at how big their feet.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Does he have something wrong with his back.

utterances.speaker: STALF
utterances.utterance: Yes. So, he had a disability when it was born. But at Ohio State we have an awesome vet, Doctor Dykes and they actually have helped this little guy out and we've had several surgeries. He's going to be just fine.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Do you want to touch him, Jesse.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: I could, but like am I allowed to pet.

utterances.speaker: STALF
utterances.utterance: Go ahead. But this is a beautiful animal, you'd find in northern North America, so Alaska, Canada, northern parts of the United States.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: One of the course pelts, wouldn't you say.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Much like your hair, Jesse.

utterances.speaker: STALF
utterances.utterance: So, look at the ear toughs right on the--

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: I know that's pretty.

utterances.speaker: STALF
utterances.utterance: isn't that beautiful.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: You know Jesse, if you stole them, we'd have a missing lynx. You know, this is Fox and Friends. PERINO: This is pretty good. This is a pretty good birthday. Thank you, Tebow for coming. We really appreciate it. And now—

utterances.speaker: STALF
utterances.utterance: Your favorite.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: We don't want the lynx and the kangaroo.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: No two toed sloth. That guy was the greatest.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: I'm going to hold the Kangaroo, OK, this is Zuko. What happen if we put Zuko down? Would he jump?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: You want to put him down. He's still young.

utterances.speaker: STALF
utterances.utterance: This is a little--

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Typical farm girl. She sees an animal; she wants to put it down.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Can we see his pouch because everybody wants to look at the pouch.

utterances.speaker: STALF
utterances.utterance: So, you want to go - just be able to. Yes, so this is a red kangaroo.

utterances.speaker: STALF
utterances.utterance: This is a young male. So--

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: There's not going to be a pouch.

utterances.speaker: STALF
utterances.utterance: There's no pouch.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: OK.

utterances.speaker: STALF
utterances.utterance: On a female and--

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Just like biology class. So, this is the largest animal in Australia. So, they'll be well pretty tall about five - about five foot.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Just as tall as Greg.

utterances.speaker: STALF
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: That was unnecessary. Smells a little rough. Someone has been in the outback for a little too long.

utterances.speaker: STALF
utterances.utterance: Beautiful animal though. Kangaroos travel about 40 miles an hour. It's unbelievable.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Greg, do you want to have a baby now. How does it feel?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes. Only if it's free and it has a pouch.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: I'll take him back. Jesse, would you like to hold him.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Sure.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Well, here you go.

utterances.speaker: PAVLICH
utterances.utterance: Getting brave, Jesse.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: And you can pass him down, because he's very easy going Zuko.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Can somebody check on CNN right now.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Go ahead. I'm good.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: What's wrong.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: It might slip me.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: OK. And we have - there is Joey and then we want to keep going because--

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: My second favorite. STALF: Well, the thing I love about this little penguin. It's a South African penguin. So, every time we talk about penguins, people think that they're--

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Don't do it. It's not worth it.

utterances.speaker: STALF
utterances.utterance: They always think that they're found in cold areas, but out of the 17 different species, only five live in the Antarctic. None live in the Arctic.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Really.

utterances.speaker: STALF
utterances.utterance: This is a tropical bird, highly endangered and the thing I love about zoos. We get 200 million people that go to zoos every single year and we raise money for conservation. And last year, the members of all zoos and aquariums that are members of the ACA, we raised $231 million for field conservation, just like this--

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: And why do you need to have - what's - wow, I've never felt a penguin.

utterances.speaker: STALF
utterances.utterance: Isn't that something.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Yes. That's the feathers, real soft.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: You've only eaten them Dana. So, you get them after they've been--

utterances.speaker: STALF
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Do they have these penguins in South Africa.

utterances.speaker: STALF
utterances.utterance: Yes. So, they're only found in South Africa and--

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: South Africans.

utterances.speaker: STALF
utterances.utterance: 20,000 breeding pair. Did you see them?

utterances.speaker: PAVLICH
utterances.utterance: I saw on the beach. That's really cool.

utterances.speaker: STALF
utterances.utterance: When you walk at the beach, it is walking right around, isn't it amazing.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Kind of walks like Mitt Romney a little bit.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: But look at this, look at the kangaroo. I think Katie he's in love with you.

utterances.speaker: PAVLICH
utterances.utterance: He's my Australian cousin.

utterances.speaker: STALF
utterances.utterance: Absolutely.

utterances.speaker: PAVLICH
utterances.utterance: So, we're bonding.

utterances.speaker: STALF
utterances.utterance: Just relax and it's so fun to see animals you know. I think they're calming and it's really a great story--

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Now, can this be used as a therapy pet on a plane?

utterances.speaker: STALF
utterances.utterance: No, no service animal here.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Emotional support penguin.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
